title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
[ENGLISH BELOW]
  
För att ansöka, vänligen inkludera ditt personliga brev och din GitHub.
  
Bli en del av Numiro som Senior Full Stack Engineer
  
Företagsbeskrivning
  
Numiro är ett fjärrstyrt, VC-finansierat AI-teknikföretag som automatiserar skatteförberedelser för amerikanska CPA-firmor, vilket minskar behovet av extra personal och dyra mjukvarulicenser. Grundat av erfarna startup-ledare med över ett decenniums erfarenhet, är vi passionerade för att skapa exceptionella kundupplevelser. Vi befinner oss just nu i fröstadiet och bygger ett världsledande team. Det här är en roll värd att lämna ditt nuvarande jobb för.
  
Rollbeskrivning
  
Vi söker en mycket självständig, fjärrstyrd ingenjör (eller baserad i Stockholm) för att bygga framtidens AI-drivna lösningar för skattehantering. Du kommer att vara en tidig anställd (grundande ingenjör) i en roll med stort inflytande, där du ansvarar för design och implementering av centrala funktioner.
  
Om dig
  
**Självgående:** Du kan leverera resultat utan befintlig infrastruktur, verktyg eller processer.
  
**Snabblärd:** Du tar snabbt till dig nya verktyg, tekniker och färdigheter.
  
**Resursstark:** Du hittar lösningar och övervinner hinder på ett uthålligt sätt.
  
**AI-augmented:** Du använder redan AI som ett verktyg för att maximera din effektivitet.
  
**Kundfokuserad:** Du fokuserar på detaljer för att leverera enastående kundupplevelser och vet också när det är dags att snabbt leverera värde.
  
  

Ansvarsområden
  
Utveckla intuitiva gränssnitt som gör det möjligt för CPA-firmor att använda AI i sitt skattearbete.
  
Designa och bygga funktioner, med ansvar för hela projektets utveckling, från start till slut.
  
Bidra till skapandet av företagets kultur samt utveckling av interna verktyg och processer.
  
  

Kvalifikationer och teknisk stack
  
**Expertis inom vår teknikstack:** Vi använder React, Next.js, GraphQL och Postgres – allt skrivet i TypeScript.
  
3+ års erfarenhet av att bygga och skala framgångsrika mjukvaruprojekt, helst självständigt eller som en del av ett litet team eller en startup i tidigt skede.
  
  

--------
  
To apply, please include your cover letter and your GitHub.
  
Join Numiro as a Senior Full Stack Engineer
  
Company Description
  
Numiro is a remote-first, VC-funded AI tech startup that automates tax preparation for US CPA firms, reducing the need for additional staff and expensive software licenses. Founded by experienced startup leaders with over a decade of expertise, we are passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences. Currently in the seed stage, we are building a world-class team. This is a role worth leaving your current job for.
  
Role Description
  
We are looking for a highly autonomous remote engineer (or based in Stockholm) to build the AI-powered future of tax solutions. You will be an early employee (founding engineer) in a high-impact role where you will own the design and implementation of core features.
  
About You
  
**Self-starter:** You can get things done without needing existing infrastructure, tooling, or processes.
  
**Quick learner:** You pick up new tools, technologies, and skills very quickly.
  
**Resourceful:** You figure out how to overcome obstacles and solve problems persistently.
  
**AI-augmented:** You are already using AI to maximize your productivity.
  
**Customer-obsessed:** You care about the details to delight customers and also know when to move fast to deliver value quickly.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Develop intuitive interfaces that allow CPA firms to leverage AI in their tax work.
  
Design and build features, owning the full development lifecycle from front to back.
  
Contribute to shaping the team culture as well as developing internal tooling and processes.
  
  

Hard Skills & Tech Stack
  
**Expertise with our stack:** We use React, Next.js, GraphQL, and Postgres – everything is written in TypeScript.
  
3+ years of experience building and scaling successful software projects, ideally independently or as part of a small team or early-stage startup.
  
  

Does this sound like your next challenge? Apply now and join us on the journey at Numiro!
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Senior Power Systems Engineer
description:
Join Our Team as Senior Power Systems Engineer
  
  

Are you a passionate electrical engineer with a knack for statistical analysis and data analytics?
  
  

We are on the lookout for two dynamic Power Systems Engineers to join our team!
  
  

This is your chance to design and optimize cutting-edge power systems while ensuring they meet standards. If you're ready to travel the world and engage with clients, this role is perfect for you!
  
  

The position can be based anywhere in any of our Swedish offices.
  
  

**What will you do:**  

* Innovate and enhance electrical power systems for maximum efficiency and reliability.
* Lead, design, and create customer projects across the Nordic zone within EcoConsult portfolio.
* Provide applied engineering and technical consultation for customers in power systems studies, design, installation, startup, maintenance, repair, and training.
* Interpret specifications and customer inquiries to design technical proposals and pricing.
* Deliver technical solutions that may involve equipment design or upgrades, testing, and improvements in safety, reliability, or efficiency.
* Mentor and lead other engineers on medium-sized projects.
* Conduct Short-Circuit, LV/MV Coordination, and Arc Flash studies.
* Independently manage medium-sized studies and projects.


What will help you to succeed
  
  

* A Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering and 5+ years of power systems engineering experience.
* Experienced with power system simulation software like PSS/E, ETAP, or DIgSILENT.
* Expertise in statistical analysis and data analytics tools like Python, R, MATLAB, and Excel.
* Knowledge of relevant standards in electrical design.
* Stellar communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for negotiation.
* A problem-solving mindset with an eye for detail and a commitment to quality.
* Willingness to travel 50% of the time for exciting customer engagements.


**Preferred Extras:**  

* Experience in pre-sales engineering or customer-facing roles.
* Experience in lead eng...
company_description: Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner.

title: Field Service Engineer - Linac / Unity
description:
Want to join a team with a mission to improve and save lives?
  
We continually look for motivated and skilled individuals who are interested in supporting our customers – healthcare professionals who use our products to help patients and their communities.
  
We currently have the following opportunity available - please contact us for more details!
  
We don't just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with Cancer.
  
Elekta is seeking a Field Service Engineer for Linac's and Unity's system to join our team! This role involves installing new equipment, providing support to existing customers, and selling spare parts. If you have a passion for technology, problem-solving, and customer service, we'd love to hear from you.
  
What you'll do at Elekta
  
Would you like to be part of our driven global team, where we aim to attract and invite the best competences to Elekta? We are offering you an exciting opportunity to join our Order Fulfilment & Service Organization.
  
This is a home-based role with a requirement to travel throughout Nordics as required and as
  
directed by the Nordic Regional Service Manager. The Elekta linear accelerators and Unity systems are high end system providing electron and photon treatments for cancer patients. The advanced systems require deep knowledge in high power, fine electronics, computer science, CBCT X-ray, MRI, water cooling systems and vacuum.
  
Responsibilities
  
Perform corrective and preventive maintenance on Elekta products after completing approved training.
  
Maintain and update customer files.
  
Provide technical support to customers and Elekta employees via phone, email, and on-site visits.
  
Train customers to use and maintain Elekta products.
  
Continuously enhance technical knowledge of Elekta equipment.
  
Participate in site visits or online meetings with the Regional Service Manager.
  
Support customers through helpdesk assistance, remote connections, or Elekta Remote Support.
  
  

**Authority & Sales Responsibilities:**  

Sell spare parts according to price lists.
  
Perform service on Elekta equipment you've been trained on.
  
Sign customer acceptance forms and hand over Elekta equipment to customers.
  
  

What you bring
  
A technical degree in Medical Engineering or Electronics.
  
Minimum 3+ yrs experience as a hospital engineer or field service engineer in two or more modalities.
  
Proficiency in computers and networking.
  
Strong command of Swedish and English, both written and verbal.
  
Passion for educating and training others.
  
Strong interpersonal and cultural awareness skills.
  
Willingness to continuously learn and improve expertise in Elekta products.
  
  

Why should you join Elekta?
  
In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.
  
Overview of some of our benefits for Sweden are as below.
  
30 vacation days/year, plus an additional 4 Elekta days off/year (plus bank holidays).
  
Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
  
Private Medical Insurance.
  
Lunch Benefit.
  
Contribution to wellness activities.
  
Company Car
  
  

We are an equal opportunity employer
  
We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
  
About Elekta
  
Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.
  
We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work.

title: QA Engineer to Dise in Karlstad
description:
At Dise, we offer market-leading software for Digital In-store experiences. Dise works with forward-thinking brands, such as Volvo, M&S, J.Lindeberg, and Uniqlo. From our offices in Sweden and the UK, we enable our partners and their customers to design and implement unique Digital In-store solutions. We call it Dise – Digital In-store experience. Dise is part of the Vertiseit Group, listed on the Nasdaq First North Growth Market in Sweden.
  
Dise is expanding and is now looking for a QA Engineer to join our team in Karlstad!
  
At Dise, we offer market-leading software for Digital In-store experiences. Dise works with forward-thinking brands, such as Volvo, M&S, J.Lindeberg, and Uniqlo. From our offices in Sweden and the UK, we enable our partners and their customers to design and implement unique Digital In-store solutions. We call it Dise – Digital In-store experience. Dise is part of the Vertiseit Group, listed on the Nasdaq First North Growth Market in Sweden.
  
The Role
  
As a QA Engineer at Dise, you will play a key role in ensuring the quality of our cutting-edge products and services. You will work closely with the development teams to drive continuous improvements in our processes and ensure we deliver first-class solutions.
  
  

**In this role, you will:**  

Develop and implement quality strategies, processes, and guidelines to ensure consistent product quality.
  
Design and execute testing methodologies, inspections, and analyses to evaluate product performance and identify areas for improvement.
  
Collaborate with development teams to identify inefficiencies and suggest improvements.
  
Investigate and resolve quality-related issues by identifying root causes and implementing corrective actions.
  
Gain a deep understanding of our products to ensure they meet high-quality standards.
  
Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and relevant certifications.
  
Define and monitor quality-related KPIs to continuously measure and enhance performance.
  
Generate reports and present insights to management on quality successes, improvement areas, and potential risks.
  
Stay up to date with QA trends, industry best practices, and emerging technologies to suggest innovative improvements.
  
Who You Are
  
We are looking for an experienced QA Engineer with a strong commitment to quality and a drive to grow. You thrive in a collaborative environment where you play an active role in improving products and processes.
  
  

**To succeed in this role, you have:**  

Knowledge of both Linux and Windows systems.
  
Previous experience working in QA teams and successfully delivering high-quality software products.
  
A strong understanding of testing methodologies, tools, and processes, along with experience in developing test plans and test cases.
  
Excellent leadership and communication skills – you are a mentor and collaborate effectively across teams.
  
An analytical mindset and problem-solving abilities – you can troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.
  
A detail-oriented and structured approach, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
  
Excellent communication and writing skills in English.
  
Why Join Dise?
  
We offer an inclusive work environment where you will be surrounded by skilled and passionate colleagues.
  
Well-being first – Enjoy health initiatives and a generous wellness allowance.
  
Team spirit & fun – We believe in having fun together and organizing activities to create great memories.
  
Learn & grow – Work alongside talented colleagues in a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
  
Job security & benefits – At Dise, we offer a collective agreement to ensure fair working conditions.
  
Career opportunities – We invest in internal career paths and development opportunities to help you grow with us.
  
Practical Information
  
**Location:** Full-time position at our office in Karlstad Application deadline: March 22 (We recruit on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible!) Questions? Contact Innar Järva at innar.jarva@dise.com
  
You can submit your application in Swedish or English. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Control system engineer
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a Thermal Controls Development and Calibration Engineer to strengthen our team in Gothenburg.
  
  

**THE ROLE:**  

We are looking for a candidate that has the ability to calibrate, tune and test Thermal Control functions using standard industry tools such as INCA. The testing activities are to be performed, ideally, in a vehicle environment so hands on experience will be very welcome. Experience with function development in Simulink is highly desirable – the SW is developed using Model Based SW development techniques in Simulink.
  
  

**AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY:**  

In-vehicle Testing, calibration and verification of thermal control functions using standard industry tools such as INCA and CANalyzer.
  
Model based software implementation of Thermal Control software using Simulink (please see competence and other requirements).
  
Participate in the cross functional system work.
  
  

**KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE:**  

Calibration experience using INCA.
  
Testing experience using industry standard tools e.g. Vector CANalyzer.
  
Diagnostics experience particularly in a development capacity; developed or experienced with diagnostics in a modelling environment, not just using diagnostics tools desirable.
  
Function development in Simulink – Thermal and/or climate experience is highly desirable.
  
System development lifecycle experience.
  
SW development lifecycle experience.
  
Data analysis using.
  
Python is desirable
  
Driver’s License B - as testing is required in a vehicle environment.

title: Development Engineer AD/ADAS
description:
ESSIQ is an IT/Technology consulting company whose journey started in 2005. The three founders had a vision to build a company where the focus is primarily on the employees. Our offer then and today: user-centred product development. We offer expertise in a wide variety of areas and we help our customers in long extensive assignments, or in short intensive projects.

 **ROLE DESCRIPTION**


As a development engineer AD/ADAS and consultant at ESSIQ, you will be part of developing the future's advanced driver assistance system (ADAS) and its functionality together with us and our customers. We are looking broadly for different skills in the field and the role will be shaped based on you and your experience.

  

You will get to work in challenging and exciting development projects with the creation of advanced driver support systems, either as a hardware or software developer or in a more leading role. The assignments are between 1-2 years and are linked to development projects that are always cross-functional. You can enter different stages in the development, either continuing development of an existing product or development of a completely new product.  

  

You have full support and coaching from your consultant manager and ESSIQ in everything you do to make you feel the sense of belonging, which lays the foundation for wanting to and making sure, you will deliver.

 **QUALIFICATIONS**

  

We think you are a civil engineer, university engineer or equivalent with a focus on electrical engineering, data, or mechatronics. You have previous experience from the automotive industry in the area of ADAS/Active Safety and one or more of the following areas:

  

* Electronics, software and system integration
* Testing, verification and testing of electronics and software
* Functional development
* Sensors, such as for example radar, lidar, ultrasound, image and accelerometer
* Senor fusion technique
* Matlab/ Simulink
* C, C++, Python
* CAN, LIN, Flexray
* Vector's products CANoe, CANalyzer and CANape
* ISO 26262
* AUTOSAR
* Work in agile teams

 **ABOUT ESSIQ AND OUR OFFER TO YOU**

  

ESSIQ is the technology consultancy where everything starts with the individual. We offer you the opportunity to shape your own career, a modern salary policy and flexible solutions! Since 2005 ESSIQ has since grown with over 200 employees and three offices that you can find in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö. With us, you have the opportunity to work on site with the client, in-house and in satellite. Your interests and driving forces lead the way and our goal is to make the perfect match between individual and mission.


ESSIQ is a family and social company. We place great emphasis on community and have an appreciated range of professional and social activities. Our communication platform is imbued with openness, and the promotion of networking and skill exchange as well as leisure activities and relationship building.

 **APPLICATION**


Selection and interviews will take place continuously, so send your application today! Please respect that we do not accept any applications by email.


Questions about the role? Contact: Fredrik Persson, Fredrik.persson@essiq.se  

  

Do you want to know more about ESSIQ?  

Visit http://essiq.se and follow us on our social media!

title: Mechanical Engineer - Solutions
description:
MilDef stands at the forefront of a critical moment in defense and security. With the largest rearmament in over three decades underway, we are committed to safeguarding those who safeguard us. Our world-leading IT equipment and unparalleled expertise empower us to meet today’s challenges head-on. To support this mission, we are expanding our team across multiple roles.


**Step into the role**


As a Mechanical Engineer in MilDef’s Solutions team, you’ll play a vital role in ensuring our products meet and exceed industry standards. At Solutions, we build and deliver customized IT systems tailored to customer specifications. We turn their IT visions into reality by providing complete and robust infrastructure solutions. Your contributions will span system design, including platform integration, cable routing, and creating robust solutions for harsh environments. You’ll collaborate with internal teams and customers, managing the process from concept to installation and verification. With your technical expertise and proactive problem-solving skills, you’ll drive innovation and help deliver products that consistently surpass customer expectations.

**Key responsibilities**

* Lead and execute integration design for MilDef’s systems and platforms in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
* Design and verify external and internal cable systems for MilDef and third-party products, ensuring they meet environmental and performance standards.
* Produce manufacturing drawings, bills of materials.
* Work with cross-functional teams, suppliers, and customers to resolve technical issues and deliver optimal design solutions.
* Contribute to system design, integration, and validation.
* Support continuous improvements in systems engineering processes, tools, and documentation to enhance efficiency and innovation.

**What you bring**

* At least three years of experience in a similar role, with a background in mechanical engineering.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
* Apply System Engineering methodology, leveraging INCOSE and ISO 15288 standards for efficient, reliable system design.
* Experience in mechanical design, including familiarity with 2D/3D engineering tools (e.g., AutoCAD) and electronics.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to consider the broader system perspective.
* A proactive and creative approach, focused on delivering high-quality results and driving continuous improvement.
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English is necessary for this role.

**Get to know us**


At MilDef, you'll be part of a company that values hands-on involvement and cross-functional collaboration. We offer the opportunity to develop new skills, contribute to a variety of projects, and make a tangible impact on our business's success.


If you're driven and ready for a challenging and rewarding role, apply now!


Do you want to know more about us? MilDef.com


For further information, please contact Anett Schmidt, Manager, or Linnéa Blixt, HR.

**Important information**


We conduct background checks and drug tests on all our future colleagues before employment.

 ***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***

*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for military, government and critical infrastructure sectors. MilDef provides hardware, software, and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest. MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia, and through partner networks in more than 40 countries. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*

**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales.**

description:

As a Requirements Engineer in MilDef’s Solutions team you will be responsible for managing requirements throughout the system lifecycle – from concept to delivery and maintenance. At Solutions, we build and deliver customized IT systems tailored to customer specifications. We turn their IT visions into reality by providing complete and robust infrastructure solutions. You play a crucial role in ensuring that system solutions are developed according to customer needs, technical specifications, and relevant industry standards. The role requires a structured and analytical approach to ensure that requirements are clear, traceable, and testable. You will collaborate closely with customers, system architects, development teams, and other stakeholders to ensure well-founded requirements management that supports MilDef’s development processes.


**Key responsibilities**

* Identify, collect, and document requirements from internal and external stakeholders

* Conduct stakeholder analysis and requirements gathering to define the correct requirements
* Collaborate with system architects and development teams to break down requirements into system and subsystem design
* Support test and verification processes to ensure that system solutions meet defined requirements
* Contribute to improving and developing MilDef’s requirements management processes

**What you bring**

* Experience in requirements management within system development, preferably in the defense, security, or electronics industry

title: Senior Linux Engineer
description:
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.

**Grow with us**
----------------

  

Our team in Ericsson is responsible for a Yocto-based distribution used internally in our company. We are now looking for senior Linux software engineers with recognized credibility across the Linux ecosystem, experience working with Yocto, and in particular a strong background working in kernel ecosystem. In this role, you will work both in the team delivering a high-quality distribution inside Ericsson and as a public contributor to projects important to Ericsson, such as the kernel. Most of the current team is located in Sweden, but what you offer is more important than where you are located.

  

Areas where our team works and your skills would be valuable include:

* Driving strategic activities on Ericsson's behalf in upstream open-source communities including, but not necessarily limited, to the Linux kernel & Yocto communities
* Implement and maintain Linux kernel extensions, such as Ericsson-written kernel modules, upstreamable enhancements, out-of-tree patches, etc.
* Work actively to upstream relevant Ericsson kernel code, in areas such as dynamic CPU isolation, scheduling, networking, and performance optimization
* Work with users of our distribution to improve kernel performance
* Support the technical staff in the organizations inside Ericsson using our Yocto-based distribution, particularly with kernel-related issues
* Setup and configure board support packages (BSPs)
* Interact with, and potentially contribute to, other FOSS projects, such as U-boot, ATF, GLIBC, etc.
* Testing of our distribution
* Bring up prototype boards and hardware in collaboration with hardware and embedded systems software development teams inside Ericsson.
* Analysis of and correction of kernel crashes
**Join our Team**
-----------------

  

Successful applicants will ideally have:

* M.S. Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or equivalent experience
* Significant experience in Linux kernel development and in contributing to the Linux kernel community (please reference patch submissions)
* Demonstrated experience and proficiency in open-source community norms and behaviours
* Experience with C, C++ and Rust
* Experience working with Yocto and in the Yocto community
* Experience working with new silicon introduction in embedded Linux environments
* Strong communication skills
  

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

  

Why join Ericsson?

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

title: Frontend Engineer - React & React Native
description:
Since our inception in 2017, Anyfin has empowered thousands across Sweden, Finland, Germany, and Norway to manage their finances better, saving millions through smart refinancing options. We’re growing rapidly and have big ambitions on the horizon, with new markets to explore and impactful products to launch. To fuel our mission, we’re seeking a dedicated and talented Frontend Engineer who’s ready to create seamless and innovative digital experiences for our users across web and mobile platforms.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Frontend Engineer at Anyfin, you’ll play an essential role in building and enhancing our user-facing applications, ensuring they are intuitive, performant, and visually stunning. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to deliver world-class solutions across web and mobile platforms. Here’s how you’ll contribute:
   

  

* Feature Development: Design, develop, and maintain features across our web and mobile platforms using React and React Native. Build reusable components and front-end libraries that promote scalability and efficiency. Contribute to our mobile app’s development using React Native, ensuring smooth functionality and aesthetic appeal on both iOS and Android.
* UI Implementation: Collaborate closely with our design team to bring pixel-perfect UIs to life, utilizing styled-components for visual consistency and Storybook for efficient component management.
* API Integration: Integrate with our GraphQL API, ensuring that data is managed seamlessly within the app, fostering efficient client-server interactions that keep our app performing at its best.
* Code Quality & Type Safety: Write well-structured, maintainable code with a strong focus on TypeScript for clarity and type safety, promoting a clean codebase and scalable solutions across the development lifecycle.
* Experimentation & Growth: Partner with our product team to implement and track features through Growth Book experiments, helping optimize user engagement and continuously improving our mobile experience.
* Testing & QA: Develop and maintain automated end-to-end tests to ensure stability and high-quality code delivery, allowing us to release with confidence and reliability.


**Who You Are**
 You have a passion for frontend development and have worked with React and TypeScript, either professionally or through personal projects. You’re eager to learn and contribute to building highly interactive web applications. While experience with React Native is a bonus, your willingness to grow into this area is what counts most. You value writing clean and maintainable code and enjoy collaborating with designers and other engineers to bring ideas to life. You’re curious about working with APIs, experimenting with new ideas, and ensuring a great user experience through testing and iteration. Most importantly, you thrive in a supportive team environment where learning and growth are celebrated.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

***Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.***
 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to reduce the costs of high-interest loans, get a detailed overview of their fixed costs, and see their credit score.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
**About Platform24**
 Platform24 is on a mission to unlock the potential of healthcare by creating smooth and accessible healthcare where patients and caregivers are empowered by the most intelligent technology available. We aim to enable AI precision while maintaining a human touch, allowing medical doctors and nurses to focus on what they do best – practicing medicine 🩺.
   

  

 We have an uncompromising focus on making every day better for patients and clinicians and together create healthcare 2.0 🚀.
   

  

 Joining our team as an Analytics Engineer means playing a key role in one of Europe's most innovative health-tech companies. You will have a significant impact and contribute to shaping the future of healthcare. Combining medical expertise with technology crafted by our engineers, we significantly improve healthcare quality and efficiency on a large scale.
   

  

 In this role, you will partner up with the rest of the analytic expertise at Platform24. This team is pivotal in driving data democratization and creating informative workflows within the company. This role spans a diverse range of responsibilities, encompassing tasks from constructing data pipelines and the development of insightful dashboards to actively contributing to advancing our data and analytic products. Beyond these responsibilities, you will elevate the analytical capabilities of other teams, fostering a culture of continuous learning.
   

  

 We invite you to join us on this exciting journey, where your contributions will significantly impact the future of healthcare.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, You Should Have**
* Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
* Proficiency with SQL.
* Experience creating visualizations using BI tools such as Superset, Metabase, Tableau, or similar.
* Good knowledge of Python is a plus.
* The ability to design and implement robust data pipelines for efficient data processing and experience with Airflow and Spark is a plus.
* Comfort working with version control and CI/CD.
* Professional experience in analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights for decision-making.
* Strong communication skills for interacting with organizational stakeholders, conveying insights, and empowering users to conduct their analyses.
* Self-driven and possesses a proactive approach to problem-solving.
* Knowledge of statistics is a plus, particularly understanding the difference between correlation and causation and identifying potential lurking variables.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is required.


**What's In It For You**
 At Platform24, we recognize the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working hours to accommodate different life plans. We host Demo & Beers every other week to celebrate our achievements (beers are optional). Regular personal growth and knowledge-sharing sessions are organized, along with other benefits like office snacks, parties, and the opportunity to spend five workdays a year doing voluntary work to help others.
   

  

 Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work with intelligent, friendly, and skilled colleagues from around the world.
   

  

 This position is located in our Stockholm office located at Münchenbryggeriet.
   

  

 We conduct ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to apply soon!
   

  

*We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.*
 Platform24 develops system support for cohesive digital care chains that facilitate increased accessibility, efficiency and medical security. We are the largest company in the Nordic region when it comes to automatic triage for directing patients to the right level of care and the right care unit, even in complex flows along the entire patient pathway.
   

  

 Our customers include healthcare regions, private care providers, and insurance companies.

title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
**Company Overview**
 Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects as-a-service across a spectrum of domains including Air & Space, Electromagnetic & Cyber, and Synthetic. Metrea Management provides central services to eleven (11) global capability units via Operations, Solutions, Strategy, Legal, and Finance teams
   

  

**Capability Unit Overview**
 Metrea Simulations (MSIM), redefines the cutting edge of flight simulation and services. Our expertise in physics, engineering and artistry allows us to leverage modern technologies in new and unprecedented ways in order to create the most realistic and immersive flight simulation training products and experiences possible. Through our technologies, customers enjoy an optimal path to efficient training, design, technology development and tactical analysis across the aviation sector. Our technology nucleus of advanced AI, flight and sensor modeling enables us to augment reality through the lens of next-generation products and services.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The test automation Engineer will be responsible for designing and maintaining Automated Framework System Inside Unreal Engine. As a part of our QA team, he/she will be constantly aiming to improve our standards and procedures, to maintain the highest possible quality of the software, by taking an active role in our chapter meetings and discussion. As well as occasionally helping manual testers in test execution.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Designing and maintaining a high level automated test framework
* Taking care of test documentation
* Working with Jira & Testrail
* Taking part in manual test execution


**Skills And Experience**
* Unreal Engine
* Experience in writing automated tests
* Experience working with Test Automation
* Managing bugs in defect tracking and test management tool(s)
* Experience in creation/maintenance of test documentation (test plan, test cases, checklists, etc )
* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
* Good spoken and written communication skills


**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**
* Test automation with Unreal Engine
* Experience with leadership position & mentoring
* Aerospace Engineering/aviation knowledge
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum development process


**Our Culture**
 Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
   

  

**Right to Work**
 The employee will have the legal right to work in the Sweden / Poland and will be able to produce right to work documentation.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities Statement**
 Metrea Management Limited (MAM) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**
 This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 37.5 hours per week with approval from the department manager.
   

  

**Work Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Work Environment (please verify the below information)**
 This job operates in a hybrid setting
   

  

**Travel**
 Not required but there will be opportunities for work related travels (e.g. trade shows, company meetings etc.)

title: Video Coding Researcher
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Ericsson's 6G vision, first introduced in 2020, remains pivotal for transforming business and society in the 2030s through secure, efficient, and sustainable communication services. Video, which is estimated to account for nearly 75% of all mobile data traffic, is an essential part of this vision and a key enabler of the emerging services anticipated in the 6G cyber-physical world. To meet the ever-increasing demands of deploying existing and future video services at scale, video coding technologies and standards continue to evolve, aiming to provide more efficient, flexible, scalable, and sustainable ways of delivering video services to consumers and businesses world-wide.
   

  

 The pace of innovation in video coding has never been as fast as now encompassing both advanced signal processing and neural network-based compression techniques. As a researcher in our team, you will be at the forefront of this development. You will invent, implement, and evaluate video coding algorithms that will become part of next generation video coding standards. You will produce software implementing novel video coding algorithms, write standardization contributions, academic publications, and patent applications.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Be working in an international team of world class researchers in video coding.
* Have your research validated and recognized in a competitive standardization environment comprising world-class experts and leaders in the video coding community.
* Be working in a dynamic department with opportunities for learning, taking on new responsibilities, impacting ways of working, and much more.


**The Skills You Bring**
* M.Sc. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical area.
* Passion and strong skills in programming.
* Interest and curiosity for solving problems and delivering innovative solutions.


**Could be an advantage but not prerequisite**
* Experience with object-oriented languages such as C++ and Python.
* Experience and interest in video coding.
* Experience and interest in signal processing and neural networks applied to video coding and processing.
* Familiarity with video coding standards such as H.265/HEVC and H.266/VVC.
* Track record in publishing in scientific journals and delivering presentations at standardization meetings, academic conferences or relevant industry events.


 We are looking forward to your application in English where you describe the value of your experience and skills in the above technical area.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 758956
   

  

 ]]>

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
 



  





 Are you curious to learn more about us? You can meet some of our coworkers and read about our departments
 **here** 
 . For insights into how is life at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit
 **this page** 
 . In our
 **Handbook** 
 , you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
 



  





*We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.* 




  





**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 



* Guide the implementation of data engineering solutions into Precis Marketing Science services and client environments, ensuring alignment with project objectives, Precis guidelines, and client expectations.
* Foster collaboration and partnership with Data Scientists and Client Services teams, effectively communicating technical requirements and insights to drive alignment towards common goals.
* Ensure client success and satisfaction by understanding client needs and objectives, proactively identifying opportunities to add value through data engineering solutions, and building strong, trusted relationships with key client stakeholders.
* Drive continuous improvement of Precis data engineering capabilities, best practices and internal processes.
* Keep current on industry trends and contribute to continuous improvement and adoption of emerging technologies and tools for enhanced services reliability, efficiency, and quality.
* Mentor and train junior team members, providing guidance and support in developing their technical competencies and professional growth within Precis.
* Define documentation standards and guidelines, overseeing the creation of comprehensive documentation for the Marketing Science team to ensure knowledge sharing and consistency within Precis.



  





**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR** 



* Expert proficiency in Python, SQL, and ETL/ELT techniques, with a demonstrated ability to design and implement complex data pipelines.
* Deep expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or similar cloud computing environments, with a proven track record of leveraging cloud technologies to drive business value.
* Proven experience overseeing project timelines and deliverables, and ensuring successful project outcomes.
* Excellent leadership and mentoring abilities, with a track record of effectively guiding and developing junior team members.
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into innovative data engineering solutions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration competencies, with a proven ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and client-facing roles.
* Proven track record of driving innovation and change.
* Experience in identifying revenue opportunities and contributing to the business strategy.



  





**WHAT WE OFFER** 




*You can read our full offering in our* 
***handbook***
*.* 



* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook - this is an
 *L3 role within the Data column* 
 . Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, ERP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare inom embedded
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY är ett ledande europeiskt företag med global räckvidd inom teknik, design och rådgivning. Vi accelererar omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle.
   

  

 Vi är 19 000 hängivna experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering, som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Längtar du efter att arbeta med problemlösning i teknikens framkant? Vill du ha möjlighet att byta perspektiv/arbetsuppgifter för att ytterligare öka din kompetens och bredd? Motiveras du av att jobba inom olika branscher och olika företag? Är du en engagerad mjukvaruutvecklare som vill jobba inom Embedded? Då finns det goda förutsättningar för att du ska trivas och utvecklas med denna tjänst! Nu förstärker vi nämligen vårt framgångsrika team inom mjukvaruutveckling i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som mjukvaruutvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta med olika produkter på både stora och mindre bolag. I din roll kommer du att arbeta med allt från hårdvarunära programmering till molnbaserade lösningar, beroende på dina tidigare erfarenheter och önskemål.
   

  

 Bredden i rollen gör att ena dagen inte liknar den andra och du kommer att ha många kontaktytor. Vad just ditt uppdrag kommer handla om styrs av din kompetens och kundens behov men också av din personliga ambition och utvecklingsplan.
   

  

**Gruppen**
 Du kommer att tillhöra ett energifyllt team där man med stort engagemang utbyter erfarenheter och stöttar varandra. Gruppen är huvudsakligen placerad i Solna men det finns möjligheter att ta uppdrag i hela Storstockholm.
   

  

**Kommentarer från blivande kollegor**
*”Gruppen har hög energi med både unga och erfarna. Det finns ett stort engagemang vilket ger en härlig känsla när vi träffas.* 
 ”
   

  

*”Jättetrevligt för alla är glada och välkomnande. Roligt med AFRY för att de alltid ser till att man har något att se fram emot såsom fester, aktiviteter och konferenser och liknande.”*
*”Det finns stor möjlighet till egenutveckling, möjlighet att styra sin karriär.”*
**Josefine Anderberg, rekryterande chef**
*"Jag är en lyhörd och energifylld ledare, som ser till din potential och förmåga. Jag tror på människans inneboende drivkraft, att alla vill göra ett fantastiskt jobb och jag kommer alltid att arbeta för att de rätta förutsättningarna ska finnas. Jag är rak och ärlig som person och värdesätter en öppen dialog mellan oss. Jag ser till din utveckling samtidigt som jag har en mycket god inblick i kundernas utmaningar, därför har vi de bästa förutsättningarna till att hitta rätt uppdrag just för dig* 
 .
 *"*
**Kvalifikationer**
 Du har en akademisk examen i datavetenskap, elektronik, mekatronik, inbyggda system eller motsvarande. Till det har du några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling eller mekatronik där du har arbetat med något eller flera av följande programspråk: C, C++, Python, C# och/eller Java. Har du dessutom arbetslivserfarenhet av Kubernetes, Docker, Azure eller AWS är det meriterande.
   

  

 Som person är du nyfiken, driven och har ett genuint intresse för teknik och problemlösning. Du gillar växlande arbetsuppgifter och utmaningar i olika miljöer, då våra uppdrag förändras med tiden. Du arbetar ständigt med att utvecklas både professionellt och som person. Du som söker har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift, samt är bosatt i Sverige.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Som konsult hos oss erbjuds du ett varierande jobb med möjligheten att arbeta i olika organisationer, branscher och projekt utan att behöva byta jobb. Du kan jobba som konsult på plats hos kund eller på plats i våra egna lokaler i något av våra inhouse-team. För oss är det viktigt att våra konsulter inte fastnar i ett uppdrag, så vi ser alltid till att hålla ögonen på nästa delmål, vare sig det handlar om ett nytt uppdrag eller kanske att vara en del av nästa kompetensutvecklingsprojekt.
   

  

 AFRY är rankat som en av Sveriges mest populära arbetsgivare bland ingenjörer. Hos oss är du med och utvecklar innovativa och hållbara lösningar inom infrastruktur, energi och industri! Du kommer att tillhöra affärsområdet Connected Products där det finns kollegor över hela landet, och lokalt i din närmsta grupp i Stockholm. Du erbjuds en bra arbetsmiljö, ett glatt gäng kollegor, och förutsättningar för en bra balans i livet - vi är din ideala arbetsgivare oavsett fas i livet.
   

  

 Clubbing - engineered by AFRY
   

  

 Från silversmide till frisbeegolf. För AFRYs medarbetare i Sverige finns möjligheten att delta i Club AFRY, en klubb vars syfte är att främja hälsan och bygga nätverk inom företaget: https://afry.com/sv/clubafry
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Kontaktperson för frågor:**
 Maja Lindqvist, rekryteringspartner
   

  

 maja.lindqvist@afry.com
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*
